text: Philippe can be so terrifying.

name: drskradley
text: He himself can't, because he's innocent and five.  But it's for that fact that it's always him that's in the messed up situations.  If Freddy Krueger were being terrorised by Michael Myers, nobody would be scared.

name: pyro_ike
text:
Well yeah, if I was five I'd be terrified in most of those situations... But that's the joy of Phillipe- he does it for you!

He is a Special Boy.

text: It looks like his fuzzy little brain is popping out.

name: avery86
text: Holy crap someone likes something that you don't! They must be below you.

name: laserblade
text: Part of the appeal of Achewood is that it can appeal to more than one sensibility, even at the same time . Yes, some of the best material in Achewood is dark and badass. Some of the best material in Achewood is sweet, too. The main difference between the Achewood version of "sweet" and the Family Circus version is that the Family Circus version is forced, while the Achewood version is earned.

name: cuddlefish
text: and he's just trying so hard to be cool

name: whuppins
text: My favorite Teodor moment.

name: epicurus
text: This one caught me totally off-guard with how hilarious it is.

name: chaesar
text: This strip (mostly Teodor's reaction) is "laugh loud enough to get you fired" funny.

name: gmagnido
text: All the tough guys use Paul Mitchell. ALL of them.

name: afkpuz
text:
I use Paul Mitchell and can verify this.

Tea Tree Mint Shampoo baby. It BURNS the sexy right into your scalp.

name: meganasty
text: You use a shampoo that has 3 plants in its name. I would check with a doctor to make sure your testicles aren't actually prolapsed ovaries.

this strip would be ten times more horrifying in color.

name: cousinted
text: You'll be happy to know that this strip also hates you.

name: deusoma
text: I understand this strip, but I don't get why Phillipe's haircut scaring Teodor is supposed to be funny.

name: dropkickpikachu
text: How is it NOT supposed to be funny?

name: zem
text: Illegal ghost bikes??? What?? Huh? He's standing on it???

name: tinhand
text: It's funny because Teodor reacts in such an extreme way, as if a shaven Philippe is basically the sum of all his fears personified. As if he then has to spend the next week in therapy before he can come back to the strip in time for Rays toilet party.

name: deusoma
text: Ohhhhhhh. Now I'm imagining Teodor reliving some horrible childhood incident involving a shaven otter, and it's retroactively hilarious.

name: tekende
text: Whatever works for you.

name: deusoma
text: And for the record, while this was just nonsensical, illegal ghost bikes straight-up sucked ass.

name: zem
text: haha ok dude

name: gormster
text: What... happened to his nose?

name: envika
text: it's still there...i think...

name: jalapenoenema
text: I've laughed out loud at Achewood before, but this is the first time that I laughed so loud I couldn't breathe.

name: killingthejay
text:
philippe looks so tough teodor scuffles away in intimidated horror. this is why he felt he should change to something less scary, like harry potter.

christ, philippe is mega nasty here.

name: dallovich
text: I never noticed before but Téodor's pants are pretty silly.

text: I picture them as being like violet brocade, like King Lear would wear.

text: Teodor's face and exactly repeated screams totally make this one.

text:
exactly repeated;
EEEEEAAAUGH! EEEEEAAAUGH! EEEEEAAAUGH!

text: It's like that scene at the end of Hannibal, with ray Liotta's exposed brain. Ray Liotta is kind of a tough guy too, so the rule still stands.

text:
Today's Blogs

Teodor: San Bruno

WHOOO finished one year of blogs motherfuckers!

name: dapooka
text: Lurk mode had to come off to provide the chubbie for your service to the Achewood community.  Especially helpful for noobs like me who start at the beginning of the archive.

name: numberkillinger
text: you are awesome

name: sp1derbaby
text: Why do I always waste my chubbies before I get down to your blog posts? Thanks for all the posts.

text: I want so badly to see Teodor's reaction to Philippe Potter there, considering what just being Philippe Willis did to him.

name: unsentletter
text:
EEEAAUGH!

Dude, indeed.

name: orvel
text:
He is a stuffed otter. That will never grow back.

And he is five.

name: atticusonline
text: EEEEEEEEEEEEEEAAAAAAAAUGH! ...  EEEEEEEAAAAUGH! ... EEEEEEAAAAAUGH!

name: red-barchetta
text: I wonder who's hair products that is? I too use the Paul Mitchell leave in conditioner.

name: saulbellow
text:
The inspiration for the very small counter with nothing but Paul Mitchell, a horse-hair brush and a razor on it could only have come from a recent barbershop visit by Mr. Onstad.

No such small hair-product counter exists in any home. Not in any home in this country, anyway.*

*By "this country," I mean America, home of the Internet since 1977. America: Where we put commas inside quotation marks, even if we are not quoting the comma. America: Try it today!

name: mangtastic
text: America!

name: jun
text: This is right up there with the one where Philippe opens his mouth.

text: Christians don't like Harry Potter.

text: Christians don't like anything that is fun. It's totally in the bible and stuff.

text: They're allowed to like music. Unlike some silly religions.

text: You KNOW that Teodor is terrified because he just smoked a few bowls and is all paranoid.  That, coupled with Phillipe, would freak ANYONE out.

text: God I can't stop laughing.

name: anabanananana
text: Anyone else impressed at Philippe's skills with the razor to make the glasses?  I have used one of those before, and instead of a haircut someone ended up with a shaved head.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: Man so close to perfect, Teodor's reaction took a second for me to realise it but when I did it was hilarious, however it seems to me that if it ended there without the Harry Potter part it would be a funnier strip, 5 instead of 4
